text:
Section: Biographies and Classes
Book: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)
It is part of the book: Su'alat al-Bardha'i (Questions of Al-Bardha'i) to Abu Zur'ah Al-Razi
Investigator: Abu Omar Muhammad bin Ali Al-Azhari
This electronic version: Compared against the Turkish manuscript and the Sa'di Al-Hashimi edition, with footnotes added. Note: These footnotes are not from the investigator of the printed edition (Take heed).
Source of the Book: Ahmed Al-Khudari Library
[Book numbering matches the printed edition]
Date of publication in Shamela: 29 Sha'ban 1443
foot_note: None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)
publisher: Al-Farooq Al-Haditha for Printing and Publishing - Cairo
text: Book of Names of the Weak Narrators by Abu Zur'ah Ubayd Allah bin Abd al-Karim al-Razi, may Allah have mercy on him.
foot_note: None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)
publisher: Al-Farooq Al-Haditha for Printing and Publishing - Cairo
text:
Abu Zur'ah had extracted the names of the weak narrators, and those spoken against among the Hadith scholars, and he spoke regarding that. So I asked him to bring out his book to me. He brought out his book in his own handwriting and handed it to me. I copied these names from the book he handed to me in his handwriting, though I did not hear it [recited] from him.

[The Letter Alif] 512 - (1) Ibrahim bin Abi Hayyah, Abu Isma'il.

513 - (2) Ibrahim bin Isma'il bin Mujammi'.

514 - (3) Ibrahim bin Isma'il bin Abi Habibah, Abu Isma'il. He narrates from Hisham bin Urwah.

515 - (4) Ibrahim bin Umar bin Aban.

516 - (5) Ibrahim bin Uthman, meaning the grandfather of Abu Bakr bin Abi Shaybah, and his Kunya is Abu Shaybah.

517 - (6) Ibrahim bin Al-Fadl.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

None

None

text:
518 - (7) Ibrahim bin Muhammad bin Al-Harith bin Khalid Al-Taymi. Musa bin Ubaydah narrated from him.

519 - (8) Ibrahim bin Muhammad bin Abi Ata', he is Ibrahim bin Muhammad Al-Aslami.

520 - (9) Ibrahim bin Muslim, Al-Hajari.

521 - (10) Ibrahim bin Muhajir bin Mismar.

522 - (11) Ibrahim bin Yazid, Abu Isma'il, Al-Khawzi.

523 - (12) Ibrahim bin Hirasa.

524 - (13) Isma'il bin Ibrahim bin Muhajir.

525 - (14) Isma'il bin Ibrahim, Abu Yahya, Al-Taymi, Al-Kufi.

527 - (16) Isma'il bin Aban, Al-Ghanawi.

528 - (17) Isma'il bin Abd al-Malik, meaning Ibn Abi al-Sufayr, the nephew of Abd al-Aziz bin Rufay'.

529 - (18) Isma'il bin Qays bin Sa'd.

530 - (19) Isma'il bin Muslim, Al-Makki.

531 - (20) Ishaq bin Abd Allah bin Abi Farwah.

publisher: Al-Farooq Al-Haditha for Printing and Publishing - Cairo
text:
727 - (216) Abd al-Jabbar bin Umar, Al-Ayli.

728 - (217) Abd al-Majid bin Abd al-Aziz bin Abi Rawwad.

729 - (218) Abd al-Warith bin Sa'id.

730 - (219) Abd al-Khaliq bin Zayd bin Waqid.

731 - (220) Abd al-Hakam Al-Qasmali.

732 - (221) Abd al-Razzaq bin Umar, Al-Shami.

733 - (222) Abd al-Muhaymin bin Al-Abbas.

734 - (223) Abd al-Ghafur, Abu al-Sabbah, the Preacher.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)
publisher: Al-Farooq Al-Haditha for Printing and Publishing - Cairo
text:
735 - (224) Abd al-Khabir. From his father, from his grandfather. Faraj bin Fadalah narrated from him.

736 - (225) Umar bin Al-Hakam, Al-Hudhali, from Basra.

737 - (226) Umar bin Muhammad bin Subhan, maternal uncle of Ibrahim bin Abi Yahya.
foot_note:
None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)
publisher: Al-Farooq Al-Haditha for Printing and Publishing - Cairo
text:
738 - (227) Umar bin Salih, Abu Hafs, Al-Azdi.

739 - (228) Umar bin Abd Allah bin Ya'la bin Murrah.

740 - (229) Umar bin Qays, Al-Makki, brother of Humayd bin Qays.

741 - (230) Uthman bin Abd al-Rahman, Al-Waqqasi.

742 - (231) Uthman bin Miqsam, Al-Burri, Abu Salamah.

743 - (232) Ali bin Al-Husayn. He heard Umar bin Abd al-Aziz. Bishr bin Al-Mufaddal narrated from him, from his father, from Ali. He was a Kharijite.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)
publisher: Al-Farooq Al-Haditha for Printing and Publishing - Cairo
text:
744 - (233) Ali bin Abi Ali Al-Lahabi. His hadith is rejected (Munkar).

745 - (234) Ali bin Asim.

746 - (235) Ali bin Yazid, Abu Abd al-Malik.

747 - (236) Amr bin Thabit.

748 - (237) Amr bin Hakkam.

749 - (238) Amr bin Khalid.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)
publisher: Al-Farooq Al-Haditha for Printing and Publishing - Cairo
text:
750 - (239) Amr bin Dinar, steward of the family of Al-Zubayr, Abu Yahya.

751 - (240) Amr bin Sa'id.

752 - (241) Amr bin Ubayd bin Bab.

753 - (242) Amr bin Waqid.

754 - (243) Isa bin Sa'id, Abu Ammar. He narrated from Ali bin Yazid Al-Dimashqi. Sa'id bin Abi Ayyub heard from him.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)

text:
755 - (244) Isa bin Ayyub, Al-Madini.

756 - (245) Isa bin Abi Isa.

757 - (246) Isa bin Sadaqah. From Abd al-Hamid, from Anas.

758 - (247) Isa bin Ibrahim Al-Hashimi.

759 - (248) Imran bin Qays. He heard Ibn Umar. Hurayth bin Abi Hurayth narrated from him.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)
publisher: Al-Farooq Al-Haditha for Printing and Publishing - Cairo
text:
760 - (249) Imran bin Abd al-Aziz, Abu Thabit. His hadith is rejected (Munkar).

761 - (250) Imran, Al-Ammi. Yahya bin Sa'id said: He was not from the people of Hadith.

762 - (251) Uqbah bin Bashir. He narrated from Abu Ja'far. Qays narrated from him and his hadith is not established.

763 - (252) Amir bin Hani. Harun bin Al-Mughirah said: from Ali bin Abd al-A'la, from his father, from him. It is not authentic.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)

text:

765 - (254) Ata' bin Abi Maymunah, Abu Mu'adh.

766 - (255) Ata', Al-Khurasani.

767 - (256) Ata' bin Ajlan.

768 - (257) Asim bin Amr. From Abu Umamah. Farqad narrated from him.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)
publisher: Al-Farooq Al-Haditha for Printing and Publishing - Cairo

770 - (259) Amarah bin Juwayn, Abu Harun, Al-Abdi.

771 - (260) Al-Ala' bin Khalid, Al-Asadi.

772 - (261) Abbas bin Al-Fadl, Al-Ansari.

773 - (262) Anbasah bin Abd al-Rahman, Al-Qurashi.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)

text:
774 - (263) Ikrimah bin Khalid bin Salamah, Al-Makhzumi.

775 - (264) Uqayl, Al-Ja'di.

776 - (265) A'idh Allah bin Abd Allah, Al-Mujashi'i. Salam bin Miskin narrated from him.

[The Letter Ghayn] 777 - (266) Ghalib bin Ubayd Allah.

778 - (267) [Ghaylan] bin Abi Ghaylan, Abu Marwan, freed slave of Uthman. Ya'qub bin Utbah narrated from him.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)
publisher: Al-Farooq Al-Haditha for Printing and Publishing - Cairo
text:
779 - (268) Ghazwan bin Yusuf, Al-Amiri, Basri (from Basra). They abandoned him (his hadith).

780 - (269) Ghiyath bin Ibrahim.

781 - (270) Ghaz bin Jabalah. His hadith is rejected (Munkar).

[The Letter Fa] 782 - (271) Fadl bin Isa, Abu Isa. Abu Salamah said: From Sallam bin Abi Muti', I heard Ayyub saying: If Fadl Al-Raqashi had been born mute, it would have been better for him.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)
publisher: Al-Farooq Al-Haditha for Printing and Publishing - Cairo
text:
783 - (272) Al-Fadl bin Mubashshir, Abu Bakr.

784 - (273) Furat bin Al-Sa'ib, Abu Sulayman. This is his Kunya in Abu Zur'ah's book in his handwriting. And it has been said: Abu Al-Mu'alla [Al-Jazari, is his Kunya].

785 - (274) Furat, father of Ali.

786 - (275) Farqad, Al-Sabkhi, Abu Ya'qub.

787 - (276) Fa'id bin Abd al-Rahman, Al-Attar.

788 - (277) Faraj bin Fadalah. From Yahya bin Sa'id Al-Attar.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)
publisher: Al-Farooq Al-Haditha for Printing and Publishing - Cairo

[The Letter Qaf] 789 - (278) Qays bin Al-Rabi'.

790 - (279) Qasim bin Abd Allah Al-Umari.

791 - (280) Qutbah bin Al-Ala' bin Al-Minhal.

792 - (281) Qaza'ah bin Suwayd.

[The Letter Kaf] 793 - (282) Kathir, Abu Hashim. From Anas. His hadith is rejected (Munkar), Abu Sulayman narrated it.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)

text:
794 - (283) Kahmas bin Al-Minhal.

795 - (284) Kuraym. From Al-Harith. It is not authentic. Abu Ishaq narrated from him.

796 - (285) Kawthar bin Hakim.

[The Letter Mim] 797 - (286) Muhammad bin Aban bin Salih.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

798 - (287) Muhammad bin Thabit, Al-Asri.

799 - (288) Muhammad bin Jabir.

800 - (289) Muhammad bin Al-Hasan bin Zabalah.

801 - (290) Muhammad bin Abi Humayd.

802 - (291) Muhammad bin Dhakwan.

803 - (292) Muhammad bin Zadhan. His hadith is rejected (Munkar).

None

None

None

None

None

None

804 - (293) Muhammad bin Ziyad, companion of Maymun.

805 - (294) Muhammad bin Sulayman bin Masmul.

806 - (295) Muhammad bin Al-Sa'ib, Al-Kalbi, Abu Al-Nadr.

807 - (296) Muhammad bin Salim, Abu Sahl.

808 - (297) Muhammad bin Sulaym, Abu Hilal. Yahya bin Sa'id used to not narrate from him.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

None

809 - (298) Muhammad bin Abd Allah bin Uthman, and he is Muhammad bin Abi Bakr. His son Al-Qasim narrated from him. They differ regarding his hadith.

810 - (299) Muhammad bin Abd Allah bin Insan.

811 - (300) Muhammad bin Abd Allah bin Ubayd bin Umayr.

812 - (301) Muhammad bin Abd al-Rahman bin Al-Baylamani.

813 - (302) Muhammad bin Abd al-Rahman, Abu Jabir, Al-Bayyad.

814 - (303) Muhammad bin Abd al-Malik.

815 - (304) Muhammad bin Ubayd Allah bin Abi Rafi'.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

None

None

None

817 - (306) Muhammad bin Umar, Al-Waqidi.

818 - (307) Muhammad bin Awn Al-Khurasani.

819 - (308) Muhammad bin Uthaym. Mu'tamir narrated from him.

820 - (309) Muhammad bin Al-Fadl bin Atiyyah.

821 - (310) Muhammad bin Kathir Al-Qassab. Yunus bin Ubayd narrated from him. His hadith is rejected (Munkar).

None

None

None

None

None

None

822 - (311) Muslim bin Khalid Al-Zanji, Abu Khalid.

823 - (312) Muhammad bin Marwan, Al-Kufi.

824 - (313) Muhammad bin Ya'la Al-Sulami, Kufi, meaning the one nicknamed Zunbur.

825 - (314) Muslim bin Kaysan, Abu Abd Allah.

826 - (315) Musa bin Dihqan. Yahya bin Sa'id said: They spoiled him at the end (of his life).

827 - (316) Musa bin Ubaydah.

828 - (317) Musa bin Abi Kathir, Abu Al-Sabah. He held the view of Qadr (Divine Decree - Qadariyyah sect).
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)

text:
829 - (318) Musa bin Muhammad bin Ibrahim bin Al-Harith.

830 - (319) Mughirah bin Ziyad. There is disturbance (Idtirab) in his hadith.

831 - (320) Awf bin Abi Jamilah, Abu Sahl.

832 - (321) Mughirah bin Musa. He narrated from Abu Arubah.

833 - (322) Mu'awiyah bin Yahya, Al-Sadafi.

834 - (323) Mu'awiyah bin Abd al-Karim, Al-Dall (The Straying).
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)

text:
835 - (324) Maymun, Abu Hamza, Al-Qassab.

836 - (325) Marwan bin Salim.

837 - (326) Marwan Abu Salamah. From Shahr.

838 - (327) Mukhtar bin Abd Allah bin Abi al-Ala'. Ibn al-Asbahani narrated from him.

839 - (328) Maysarah bin Abd Rabbih. A liar.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)
publisher: Al-Farooq Al-Haditha for Printing and Publishing - Cairo
text:
840 - (329) Mukhtar bin Nafi'.

841 - (330) Mu'alla bin Irfan.

842 - (331) Ma'bad, Al-Juhani.

843 - (332) Matar bin Maymun. Yunus bin Bukayr narrated from him.

844 - (333) Musayyab bin Sharik.

845 - (334) Miswar bin Al-Salt.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)
publisher: Al-Farooq Al-Haditha for Printing and Publishing - Cairo
text:
846 - (335) Mahdi bin Hilal.

847 - (336) Mubarak bin Mujahid, Abu al-Azhar. Qutaybah said: He was a Qadari (believer in free will).

848 - (337) Mubarak bin Suhaym, freed slave of Abd al-Aziz bin Suhayb.

849 - (338) Mihran bin Abi Umar, Al-Razi.

850 - (339) Muthanna bin Al-Sabbah.

851 - (340) Mujalid bin Sa'id. Ahmad bin Hanbal said: He is nothing.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)
publisher: Al-Farooq Al-Haditha for Printing and Publishing - Cairo
text:
852 - (341) Muhriz bin Harun.

853 - (342) Muhill bin Muhriz, Al-Dabbi.

854 - (343) Munkadir bin Muhammad.

[The Letter Nun] 855 - (344) Nu'man bin Thabit, Abu Hanifah. He died in the year one hundred and fifty.

856 - (345) Al-Nadr bin Muhammad, Al-Marwazi. There is weakness in him.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)
publisher: Al-Farooq Al-Haditha for Printing and Publishing - Cairo
text:
857 - (346) Al-Nadr, Al-Khazzaz, Al-Kufi.

858 - (347) Al-Nadr bin Mutriq.

859 - (348) Al-Nadr bin Mansur.

860 - (349) Nuh. From Abu Mijlaz. Layth narrated from him. His hadith is rejected (Munkar).
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)
publisher: Al-Farooq Al-Haditha for Printing and Publishing - Cairo
text:
861 - (350) Najih, Abu Ma'shar.

862 - (351) Nasih, Abu al-Ala', freed slave of Banu Hashim.

863 - (352) Nasih bin Abd Allah, the one from whom Simak narrated.

[The Letter Waw] 864 - (353) Al-Walid bin Muhammad, Al-Muwaqqari, Abu Bishr.

865 - (354) Wahb bin Wahb, Abu al-Bakhtari. A liar.

866 - (355) Wasil bin Al-Sa'ib.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)
publisher: Al-Farooq Al-Haditha for Printing and Publishing - Cairo
text:
867 - (356) Wazi' bin Nafi'.

868 - (357) Waqid bin Salamah.

[The Letter Ha] 869 - (358) Hilal bin Zayd bin Yasar, and it is said: He is Abu Uqal.

870 - (359) Al-Haytham bin Adi. They remained silent about him.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)
publisher: Al-Farooq Al-Haditha for Printing and Publishing - Cairo
text:
871 - (360) Harun bin Harun, Al-Taymi.

[The Letter Ya] 872 - (361) Yahya bin Abi Anisah.

873 - (362) Yahya bin Bistam, Al-Asfar.

874 - (363) Yahya bin Ubayd Allah, Al-Madini.

875 - (364) Yahya bin Uthman. He narrated from Abu Hazim. Ikrimah bin Ammar narrated from him.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)
publisher: Al-Farooq Al-Haditha for Printing and Publishing - Cairo
text:
876 - (365) Yahya bin Abi Hayyah, Abu Janab.

877 - (366) Yahya bin Salamah bin Kuhayl.

878 - (367) Yahya bin Abd al-Hamid, Al-Himmani.

879 - (368) Yahya bin Al-Ala', Al-Razi. Waki' used to speak against him.

880 - (369) Yahya bin Yazid, Abu Shaybah, Al-Ruhawi.

881 - (370) Yahya bin Ya'qub bin Mudrik.

882 - (371) Yazid bin Aban, Al-Raqashi.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)
publisher: Al-Farooq Al-Haditha for Printing and Publishing - Cairo
text:
883 - (372) Yazid bin Rabi'ah, Abu Kamil, Al-Dimashqi.

884 - (373) Yazid bin Ziyad. He narrated from Al-Zuhri.

885 - (374) Yazid bin Sufyan, Abu al-Muhazzim.

886 - (375) Yazid bin Abd al-Malik bin Al-Mughirah bin Nawfal.

887 - (376) Yazid bin Iyad bin Ja'dabah, Al-Laythi.

888 - (377) Yazid bin Hurmuz, freed slave of Banu Layth, from Abu Hurayrah.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)
publisher: Al-Farooq Al-Haditha for Printing and Publishing - Cairo
text:
889 - (378) Yusuf bin Maymun Al-Sabbagh.

890 - (379) Yusuf bin Atiyyah.

891 - (380) Yusuf bin Khalid, Al-Samti.

892 - (381) Yusuf bin Ziyad, Abu Abd Allah, Al-Nahdi.

893 - (382) Ya'qub bin Ibrahim, Abu Yusuf, who was in charge of the judiciary, meaning the companion of Abu Hanifah.

894 - (383) Yasa' bin Talhah. His hadith is rejected (Munkar).

895 - (384) Yaman bin Al-Mughirah, Abu Hudhayfah.

896 - (385) Yasin bin Mu'adh, Al-Zayyat, Abu Khalaf.
foot_note:
None

None

None

None

None

None

None

None

book_title: Names of the Weak Narrators (Asami al-Du'afa)
publisher: Al-Farooq Al-Haditha for Printing and Publishing - Cairo
text:
[The Kunyas (Nicknames)] 897 - (386) Abu Bakr bin Abd Allah bin Abi Sabrah.

898 - (387) Abu al-Rahhal, Khalid bin Muhammad. He heard Al-Nadr bin Anas. His hadith is rejected (Munkar).

899 - (388) Abu Majid, Al-Hanafi. Abu Zur'ah said: Al-Humaydi said: Ibn Uyaynah said: I said to Yahya Al-Jabir: 'Who is Abu Majid Al-Hanafi?' He said: 'A bird flew upon us, and he narrated to us.' He is rejected in hadith (Munkar al-Hadith). End of the Names.

None
